instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: 00138 won't finish loading OS
threads.message:
Originally this board would not start had blown caps and bad <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> corrosion around that area had to jumper pin 6 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.

This board seems to work right BUT shows VDH002 in AHT. The Mac runs mostly normal but has strange pauses like when loading boot option screen there seems to be a long pause. I can format and erase the drive in OS install screens. Install starts and either goes to black screen or with other OS gets stuck early on restart/load screen and then boots back to install OS stage. No corrosion around SSD connector. Runs good with external OS.

DIode tested all SSD port pins red to ground and compared to working board and everything looks very good there. Tried a different SSD also, same result.

Not sure where to go from here...

threads.title: 00138 won't finish loading OS
threads.message:
Run HWMonitor and check SSD specs (current, temp).

Just in case, reflash SPI chip with known good BIOS (clean ME).

threads.title: 00138 won't finish loading OS
threads.message: I was able to resolve this by planting a pre-loaded SSD, doing PRAM, SMC resets and selecting the SSD as target disk. Reloaded successfully and no errors in AHT anymore.
